name: Sharon Rogone
summary: Engineer and inventor who developed neonatal medical devices to improve care for premature infants.
shortDescription: Sharon Rogone is an engineer and inventor who created the Brica Baby Travel Bed, a portable sleeping solution for infants. She designed a safe, portable bed that can be used anywhere, making travel easier for families with young children. Her invention demonstrates how engineering can solve everyday problems and improve family life.

detailed_description.early_life: Born in 1950, Sharon showed an early interest in engineering and solving practical problems. She pursued her education in engineering with a focus on product design and safety.
detailed_description.stem_journey: Sharon became an engineer and inventor who focused on creating practical solutions for families. She developed the Brica Baby Travel Bed to address the need for safe, portable sleeping solutions for infants.
detailed_description.challenges: Faced challenges as a woman in engineering and had to prove that her invention could meet safety standards and be commercially viable.
detailed_description.achievements: Invented the Brica Baby Travel Bed, created a safe portable sleeping solution for infants, and demonstrated how engineering can improve family life.
detailed_description.legacy: Sharon has helped make travel easier for families with young children and shown how engineering can solve everyday problems.

impact: Made travel easier for families with young children and demonstrated how engineering can solve everyday problems.
mentorship: Inspired other engineers to focus on practical solutions that improve family life.
fun_fact: Sharon's Brica Baby Travel Bed has helped millions of families travel safely with infants.
